required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Does Preoperative 3 D Ultrasound Improve Sling Placement
clinical_study.official_title: Does Preoperative 3 D Ultrasound Improve Sling Placement

brief_summary.textblock: This purpose of this study is to study whether the use of a 3D preoperative ultrasound is helpful to determine where to place the sling in the mid female urethra.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study will assess the effect of 3D preoperative ultrasound in optimization of sling placement in the mid female urethra. Women who have chosen to undergo trans-vaginal tape sling (TVT) for stress urinary incontinence will be asked to enroll in this randomized trial. Ten women will be randomized to receive a preoperative ultrasound before surgery and 20 women will have our normal pre-operative assessment (which does not include an ultrasound) for the treatment of symptomatic stress urinary incontinence. Randomization will be performed by the FPMRS study coordinator after a woman has given her informed consent and meets the study criteria. Women randomized to receive a preoperative 3-D ultrasound will then undergo a 5-minute trans-vaginal ultrasound (BK Flex Focus ultrasound with the 8838 transvaginal probe). The ultrasound will measure the urethral length and identify the mid-urethra region for that patient. The measurement will be placed in the pre-operative note. Transvaginal ultrasound is well-tolerated and has no complications associated with it. Women who receive our "usual care" will have no pre-operative ultrasound performed. Women enrolled in the study will then proceed to surgery as scheduled.
At the time of surgery the information on the length of the urethra will be used to determine the placement of the sling. The surgery will proceed in its usual fashion.
Using the BK Flex Focus ultrasound with a trans-vaginal (8838) and translabial transducers. These transducers are commonly used to assess for pelvic masses, abnormalities or foreign body. We will measure and record the length of the urethra and will map out the mid-urethral point for sling placement; we will also compare the urethral length measurement obtained by preoperative 3D ultrasound to intra-operative urethral length measurement using a Foley catheter. Measurements will be recorded from the bladder neck to the urethral opening. A representational image will be saved.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic

primary_outcome.measure: To assess if preoperative 3D ultrasound will optimize sling placement in the mid-urethra
primary_outcome.description: To assess if preoperative 3D ultrasound will optimize sling placement in the mid-urethra. Measurement of the urethral length in cm using the 3 D ultrasound and marking the mid-urethral point for sling placement. We will then compare the mid-point location of the midurethral sling between the group that received a preoperative ultrasound to the group that didn't receive a preoperative ultrasound at 6 weeks for both groups using the 3 D ultrasound. The measurements of the location of the mid-point of the urethral sling will be compared between the two groups (those who received a preoperative ultrasound and those who did not receive it)

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the accuracy of 3D ultrasound in measurement of urethral length compared to intraoperative measurement of the urethral length
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the accuracy of 3D ultrasound in measurement of urethral length compared to intraoperative measurement of the urethral length

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess for migration of mid-urethral slings 6 weeks after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of the urethral length in cm using the 3 D ultrasound and marking the mid-urethral point for sling placement. We will then compare the mid-point location of the midurethral sling between the group that received a preoperative ultrasound to the group that didn't receive a preoperative ultrasound at 6 weeks for both groups using the 3 D ultrasound. The measurements of the location of the mid-point of the urethral sling will be compared between the two groups (those who received a preoperative ultrasound and those who did not receive it)

secondary_outcome.measure: Stratify the data based on patient race, BMI, prolapse and age
secondary_outcome.description: Stratify the data based on patient race, BMI, prolapse and age

arm_group.description: 10 women will not have a preoperative 3D ultrasound

intervention.description: 10 women with preoperative 3D ultrasound and 10 women without preoperative 3D ultrasound.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Candidates for TVT
- >=18 years of age to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to give informed consent
- Previous SUI treatment including TVT, Burch or urethral bulking agents
- Previous bladder, urethral malignancies or vaginal/pelvic radiation treatment.
- Pregnant women cannot participate
